author: Andrew Beaton
title: Homemade Highlights: A Russian Duel for Figure Skating Gold
text:
0 COMMENTS The women’s figure skating final in Pyeongchang came down to a duel: Russia athlete Alina Zagitova vs. Russia athlete Evgenia Medvedeva.
The 15-year old newcomer Zagitova back-loaded her routine with impressive jumps, all with her hands over her head. But two-time European champion Medvedeva answered with her own outstanding performance.
Watch more Olympics videos here Medvedeva finished up weeping -- as the entire world awaited a gold medal that could have gone either way and came down to a little more than a point difference. But it was the younger skater who took home gold.
Unfortunately, we can’t show you those precise highlights. NBC paid over $1 billion for the rights to broadcast this and all other Olympic events at the Winter Games in South Korea. The Wall Street Journal paid far less than that to bring you this exclusive look at highlights from the first-ever Olympic big air competition -- portrayed by puppets.
We’re very serious about this.
